00014 void            receive_free(t_receive *x);
00015 void            receive_assist(t_receive *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst);

00017 void            receive_setcallback(t_receive *x, void *callback, void *arg);
00018 void            receive_dispatch(t_receive *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);

00022 // Globals
00023 static t_class          *s_receive_class;                                       // Required: Global pointer the jcom.receive class
00024 static t_object         *s_receivemaster_object = NULL;         // An instance of the jcom.receivemaster class
00025

00027 /************************************************************************************/
00028 // Main() Function
00029 
00030 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00031 {
00032         receivemaster_initclass();
00033         receive_initclass();
00034         return 0;
00035 }
00036 
00037 
00038 void receive_initclass()
00039 {
00040         long attrflags = 0;
00041         t_class *c;
00042         t_object *attr;
00043         
00044         jamoma_init();
00045         
00046         // Define our class
00047         c = class_new(  "jcom.receive", 
00048                                         (method)receive_new, 
00049                                         (method)receive_free, 
00050                                         (short)sizeof(t_receive), 
00051                                         (method)0L, 
00052                                         A_GIMME, 
00053                                         0);
00054         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_receive, obex));
00055 
00056         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00057         class_addmethod(c, (method)receive_dispatch,            "dispatch",                     A_CANT, 0);
00058         class_addmethod(c, (method)receive_setcallback,         "setcallback",          A_CANT, 0);
00059     class_addmethod(c, (method)receive_assist,                  "assist",                       A_CANT, 0);
00060     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,     "dumpout",                      A_CANT, 0);  
00061     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,    "quickref",             A_CANT, 0);
00062         
00063         // ATTRIBUTE: name
00064         attr = attr_offset_new("name", _sym_symbol, attrflags,
00065                 (method)0, (method)receive_setname, calcoffset(t_receive, attr_name));
00066         class_addattr(c, attr);
00067         
00068         // Finalize our class
00069         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00070         s_receive_class = c;
00071 }
00072 
00073 
00074 /************************************************************************************/
00075 // Object Life
00076 
00077 // Create
00078 void *receive_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00079 {
00080         long            attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);               // support normal arguments
00081         t_receive       *x = (t_receive *)object_alloc(s_receive_class);
00082         if(x){
00083                 object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (object *)outlet_new(x, NULL));
00084                 x->outlet = outlet_new(x, NULL);
00085 
00086                 if(!s_receivemaster_object)
00087                         s_receivemaster_object = (t_object *)object_new(CLASS_NOBOX, gensym("jcom.receivemaster"));
00088 
00089                 x->callback = NULL;
00090                 x->attr_name = NULL;
00091                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                                       // handle attribute args                                
00092 
00093                 // If no name was specified as an attribute
00094                 if(x->attr_name == NULL){
00095                         if(attrstart > 0)
00096                                 x->attr_name = atom_getsym(argv);
00097                         else
00098                                 x->attr_name = gensym("jcom.receive no arg specified");
00099                         receive_bind(x);
00100                 }
00101         }
00102         return x;
00103 }
00104 
00105 
00106 // Destroy
00107 void receive_free(t_receive *x)
00108 {
00109         receive_remove(x);
00110 }
00111 
00112 /************************************************************************************/
00113 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00114 
00115 // Method for Assistance Messages
00116 void receive_assist(t_receive *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00117 {
00118         if(msg==1)      // Inlets
00119                 strcpy(dst, "(signal) input to the module");
00120         else if(msg==2){ // Outlets
00121                 if(arg == 0) 
00122                         strcpy(dst, "output from remote");
00123                 else 
00124                         strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00125         }
00126 }
00127 
00128 
00129 // ATTRIBUTE: name
00130 t_max_err receive_setname(t_receive *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00131 {
00132         t_symbol *arg = atom_getsym(argv);
00133         
00134         if(x->attr_name != arg){
00135                 receive_remove(x);
00136                 x->attr_name = arg;
00137                 receive_bind(x);                
00138         }
00139         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00140         #pragma unused(attr)
00141 }
00142 
00143 
00144 // 
00145 void receive_bind(t_receive *x)
00146 {
00147         object_method(s_receivemaster_object, ps_add, x->attr_name, x);
00148 }
00149 
00150 
00151 void receive_remove(t_receive *x)
00152 {
00153         object_method(s_receivemaster_object, ps_remove, x->attr_name, x);
00154 }
00155 
00156 
00157 // This method is called by jcom.receivemaster
00158 // In reponse, we figure out if we should send the data to our outlet
00159 void receive_dispatch(t_receive *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00160 {
00161         if(x->callback)
00162                 x->callback(x->baton,  msg, argc, argv);        // call the registered callback on the object that we're instantiated inside of
00163         else
00164                 outlet_anything(x->outlet, msg, argc, argv);
00165 }
00166 
00167 
00168 //      When we are inside of another external, we need a way to transmit messages
00169 //      to it. This function sets up another callback, which can call a function 
00170 //      in that external to transmit the message.
00171 void receive_setcallback(t_receive *x, void *callback, void *arg)
00172 {
00173         x->callback = (t_receive_obex_callback)callback;
00174         x->baton = arg;
00175 }
